data.text: Of these things be not thou ashamed,
Of the law of the most High, and his covenant;
Of reckoning with thy partners and travelers;
Of exactness of balance and weights;
And of merchants’ indifferent selling;
Sure keeping is good, where an evil wife is;
Deliver all things in number and weight;
Be not ashamed to inform the unwise and foolish,
A daughter is a wakeful care to a father;
In her virginity, lest she should be defiled
Keep a sure watch over a shameless daughter,
Behold not everybody’s beauty,
For from garments cometh a moth,
Better is the churlishness of a man than a courteous woman,
I will now remember the works of the Lord,
The sun that giveth light looketh upon all things,
The Lord hath not given power to the saints to declare all his marvelous works,
He seeketh out the deep, and the heart,
Declaring the things that are past, and for to come,
No thought escapeth him,
He hath garnished the excellent works of his wisdom,
Oh how desirable are all his works!
All these things live and remain forever for all uses,
All things are double one against another:
One thing establisheth the good of another:
